comment: EXTRACREDIT you have to take him, he wants you to practice and learn orgchem so homework and extra credit is every pouring. Just think of the homework as free points. This class is hard but if you want a professor who will work with you to make you get an A it's him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Orgo2 Lab had more lab reports than Orgo1, and one of them is really, coming from 4 lab days worth of work. The reports can take a lot of time out of class, but he will help out if you seek it. He really loves doing prelab lecture which takes time away from the experiment so you must be efficient once doing the actual lab work. I enjoyed his lab.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: His lectures from Orgo1 to Orgo2 were different. He changed up his style, sought more class participation, and gave a TON of extra credit. He was always available for help and wanted to make sure you understood the material, whether asking in office hours or in class. In my opinion his teaching improved with more experience. I recommend taking.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He really enjoyed teaching lab. His prelab lectures were very in depth and used his real world experiences. He was a tough grader, but he laid out exactly how his reports/questions should be answered, and he was always available for help if needed. He was very helpful if your experiment ran into issues to get you back on track.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: It is a tough course but if you study, do the practice problems, and go to his office hours for help, you will definitely pass (if that is all you want) and if you work really hard you can make an A. He showed respect to students and appreciated when you sought help. He really wanted you to understand the material, not just memorize and forget it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Really nice guy, willing to meet with you and help guide, but I found that his lectures were less helpful than the SI. Sometimes he doesn't do the example problems in lecture correctly.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I read all of these reviews prior to taking Dr Owens and was pretty intimidated before going in. I mean, yes, he is a new teacher and his lecture style wasn't for me at all, but it's still very doable. I failed every test (badly) and still passed with a C. Just read, get ClutchPrep, and scoop up all of the extra points that he throws out
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Teaching method is not for me whatsoever. He more so tells you than explain the content. You end up teaching yourself. Went to his office hours and still didn't explain the mechanism/reaction. I dropped the class and retook it! Best decision I ever made. Overall if you have him you will teach yourself. Study hard and pray!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I had him for Ochem 1 lab. He takes a really long time explaining pre-lab since he goes pretty in depth. His grading criteria is very specific when it comes to lab reports, but no quizzes though. Use his office hours if you need help with reports! He's really helpful and nice, he'll even check them if you give him a draft before turning it in.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I had him for orgo2 lab. God help. He waits to the night before lab to post the write up that you have to copy. He takes forever to get grades back on your papers so by the time you realize you have been doing something wrong on your reports, you have already turned in three more. He is a sweetheart but just utterly oblivious to how hard he is.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: For his first semester of teaching, he did a good job in my opinion. His test are pretty straightforward with what he lectures, but you HAVE to put forth the effort. Orgo is not an easy course. I'm taking him again for Orgo 2, and hope for an A in there also! He drops the lowest test grade with your final. Study hard, practice and you'll do fine!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very nice guy  but his teaching method wasn't for me at all. I had to teach myself the information at home for this class. Orgo isnt an easy class you have to do practice problems to get a good grade. Does not give partial credit even if its a minor error. You get between 8-10 extra credit points on each test
rating_tags: Tough Grader--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He has no structure! Does not give partial credit on test! I went to his office to ask about grading system and he was very arrogant. If you are very strong in you chem skills and can understand the information without the teachers help then go for it , if not don't risk it!

This is his first time ever teaching, so for all we know, he might make a complete 180 for O Chem 2. I would not recommend him for O Chem, but if you're signed up for him next semester, just wait it out. Try to get someone else, but don't fret if you can't. He is a nice guy who wants you to do well, but he just can't teach.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: He's a nice guy, very accessible and willing to help you out. He just needs to learn how to organize his lectures to be more efficient and adapt his teaching to how students learn best. If he's willing to make some changes I think he has the potential to be a great professor. But for now choose a different professor with more teaching experience.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Avoid at any cost. He gives generic examples during lectures. His notes are all over the place. His practice problems are nothing like the ones on the test. He gives no partial credit. Expects students to show up to his office. Sorry but if you can't teach it during lecture most likely you won't be able during office hours. Textbook  Him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He started stating that he wanted to make organic more fun and understandable. Well, he failed! He gives A few examples for each topic and practice problems that aren't graded and then takes those at times them by 100 and you have the difficulty of his tests! He only gives 3 homeworks and most quizzes have 3 questions. No partial credit. AVOID HIM!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Has no patience and gets annoyed with students. He is very sporadic when writing notes and is hard to keep up with, and doesn't explain concepts. He spends the class period doing examples of a few problems that you won't see again. The book is your teacher. Barely any homework to balance out test grades, and does not give partial credit on tests.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Who's idea was it to hire this guy, seriously? He cannot teach, and gives no partial credit, even if your answer is basically correct with a very minor error. He may seem nice and there for you at first, but please, do not believe that my friend. Change your professor. You have been warned!!!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is an easy guy to learn from and his teaching style worked for me. 3 tests and a final are the bulk of your grade. Partial credit is not a thing so know the material. When he says to memorize something HAVE IT MEMORIZED. Read your book ahead of time that way you have a preview into what he will lecture about. He didn't do ACS final exam.........
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Clearly was his first semester teaching. I regret not withdrawing when I had the change. AVOID AT ANY COST. Nice guy but shows no mercy or partial credit when grading. My answer was 99% close to the correct one. Instead of giving any credit he wrote "so close" and marked it as wrong. Your textbook will be your real teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Owens is clearly a very smart man, but a horrible teacher. His lectures are very convoluted and he is incapable of explaining core concepts. His tests are ridiculously hard and he refuses to give partial credit. Even if 99% of your answer is right, he will take off all ten points. OCHEM is a hard class, but this was hard in stupid ways.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Nice, attractive, & extremely smart guy; first semester teaching . First half of the semester was tolerable but once withdrawal day hit, everything went downhill. Expects you to know everything. Scribbles notes on projector. Will not give partial credit. Tough grader on labs/exams. Practice worksheets and quizzes are nothing like the exams. AVOID.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Quite a good looking guy, so at least you'll have something nice to look at while you miserably fail the class. It's his first time teaching ever, so you would expect him to be a bit more forgiving on grading, right? Not at all. He "teaches" just by drawing structures on the board, and expects you to know everything else. Avoid!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Please avoid! Unnecessarily tough tests, and he has no idea how to teach. Oh, and he's also a harsh lab grader, so take someone else.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Do NOT take his class if you can help it. The way he lectures and grades tests is ridiculous. He makes it very hard to pass and I'm pretty sure more than half of the class has to retake.
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: I took him for the lab and he was extremely helpful but he doesn't like to baby students. He wants you to know the material and know it well, so he expects a lot. TOUGH grader. I've always managed as easy A in labs and this one i'm really having to work for. If you're not strong in chemistry I would advise you take Dr. Alexander.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Very nice guy who seems like like he'll be great at first, but that slowly unraveled after the first few weeks. Don't get me wrong, he's a great  guy, but a terrible professor. He is also very bad in lab, so avoid him for both lecture and lab. Again, a very nice guy, but an awful teacher. Please do yourself a favor and avoid him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Worst professor at Kennesaw State university. If you care about your GPA and your future, then, please take anyone else but him. The man has no idea how to teach the material. I am sure he understands it himself; however, teaching is a whole another ball game. You can try to complain to the department; however, that does not work (trust me).
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This was his first semester teaching and you could tell. I know organic is a hard class as it is and have to put in extra work outside of class, but he should not be teaching it. His handwriting is awful and his notes are scattered and make no sense Unless it just naturally clicks with you, you will not do well in his class. DO NOT TAKE HIM.
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: Just dont take his class. He gives off the impression of a good professor, he is young and can relate to the life of his students, but in actuality its bad. He gives practice work and online HW, this work is nothing like the quizzes or test. Most of his class isnt doing good in there. And the people who took him for lab wish they didnt take him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr Owens rocks. He spent the first few days of class assuring us that we wouldn't fail and covering the basics. He knows what it's like to be a student and doesn't try to trick you in exams. Go to class, TAKE ALL THE NOTES, read the book and you can  pass. Organic Chem is a crazy hard class and he makes it semi reasonable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Respected

comment: It was his first semester ever teaching and I had him for lab as well. If there is any other teacher then take them. He will say that he cares but plays favorites and is passive aggressive to others. Very smart man but I don't think he has the patience or compassion for teaching. Worst experience with a professor ever.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.
